Bu modelning bashoratlari qanchalik xatosiz ekanligini o'lchaydi. Aniqlik narx haqidagi ma'lumotni o'z ichiga olmaydi, shuning uchun kamroq aniqroq model tejamkorroq bo'lishi mumkin.

definition_eng: A function used by a node in a neural net to transform input data from any domain of values into a finite range of values. The original idea was to approximate the way neurons fired, and the activation function took on the value 0 until the input became large and the value jumped to 1. The discontinuity of this 0-or-1 function caused mathematical problems, and sigmoid-shaped functions (e.g., the logistic function) are now used.
definition_uz: Neyron tarmog'idagi tugun tomonidan istalgan qiymatlar domenidan kiritilgan ma'lumotlarni cheklangan qiymatlar oralig'iga aylantirish uchun foydalaniladigan funksiya. Asl g'oya neyronlarning otilish usulini taxmin qilish edi va faollashtirish funktsiyasi kirish katta bo'lguncha va qiymat 1 ga sakrab chiqmaguncha 0 qiymatini oldi. Ushbu 0-yoki-1 funksiyaning uzilishi matematik muammolarni keltirib chiqardi va sigmasimon shaklga ega edi. funksiyalaridan (masalan, logistika funksiyasi) hozir foydalanilmoqda.

definition_eng: When an association between two variables is defined, the first item (or left-hand side) is called the antecedent. For example, in the relationship “When a prospector buys a pick, he buys a shovel 14% of the time,” “buys a pick” is the antecedent.
definition_uz: Ikki o'zgaruvchi o'rtasidagi assotsiatsiya aniqlanganda, birinchi element (yoki chap tomon) oldingi element deb ataladi. Misol uchun, munosabatlarda "Qidiruvchi bolg'a  sotib olayotganda

definition_eng: An application program interface. When a software system features an API, it provides a means by which programs written outside of the system can interface with the system to perform additional functions. For example, a data mining software system may have an API which permits user-written programs to perform such tasks as extract data, perform additional statistical analysis, create specialized charts, generate a model, or make a prediction from a model.
definition_uz: Ilova dasturi interfeysi. Agar dasturiy ta'minot tizimida API mavjud bo'lsa, u tizimdan tashqarida yozilgan dasturlar qo'shimcha funktsiyalarni bajarish uchun tizim bilan interfeysga kirishi mumkin bo'lgan vositani taqdim etadi. Misol uchun, ma'lumotlarni qidirish dasturiy ta'minot tizimi foydalanuvchi tomonidan yozilgan dasturlarga ma'lumotlarni ajratib olish, qo'shimcha statistik tahlil qilish, ixtisoslashtirilgan diagrammalarni yaratish, model yaratish yoki modeldan bashorat qilish kabi vazifalarni bajarishga imkon beruvchi IDIga ega bo'lishi mumkin.

definition_eng: An association algorithm creates rules that describe how often events have occurred together. For example, “When prospectors buy picks, they also buy shovels 14% of the time.” Such relationships are typically expressed with a confidence interval.
definition_uz: Assotsiatsiya algoritmi hodisalar qanchalik tez-tez birga sodir bo'lganligini tavsiflovchi qoidalarni yaratadi. Misol uchun, "Qidiruvchilar bolg'a sotib olayotganda

definition_eng: A training method used to calculate the weights in a neural net from the data.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlardan neyron tarmog'idagi og'irliklarni hisoblash uchun ishlatiladigan o'quv usuli.

definition_eng: In a neural network, bias refers to the constant terms in the model. (Note that bias has a different meaning to most data analysts.)
definition_uz: Neyron tarmog'ida bias modeldagi doimiy atamalarni anglatadi. (E'tibor bering, ko'pchilik ma'lumotlar tahlilchilari uchun bias boshqacha ma'noga ega.)

definition_eng: A data preparation activity that converts continuous data to discrete data by replacing a value from a continuous range with a bin identifier, where each bin represents a range of values. For example, age could be converted to bins such as 20 or under, 21-40, 41-65 and over 65.
definition_uz: Uzluksiz diapazondagi qiymatni axlat identifikatori bilan almashtirish orqali uzluksiz ma?lumotlarni diskret ma?lumotlarga o?zgartiruvchi ma?lumotlarni tayyorlash faoliyati, bunda har bir quti qiymatlar oralig?ini ifodalaydi. Masalan, yoshni 20 yoki undan kichik, 21-40, 41-65 va 65 yoshdan katta kabi qutilarga aylantirish mumkin.

definition_eng: Training data sets are created by re-sampling with replacement from the original training set, so data records may occur more than once. In other words, this method treats a sample as if it were the entire population. Usually, final estimates are obtained by taking the average of the estimates from each of the bootstrap test sets.
definition_uz: O'quv ma'lumotlar to'plami dastlabki o'quv to'plamini almashtirish bilan qayta namuna olish yo'li bilan yaratiladi, shuning uchun ma'lumotlar yozuvlari bir necha marta sodir bo'lishi mumkin. Boshqacha qilib aytadigan bo'lsak, bu usul namunaga xuddi butun populyatsiya kabi munosabatda bo'ladi. Odatda, yakuniy baholar bootstrap test to'plamlarining har biridan o'rtacha baho olish yo'li bilan olinadi.

definition_eng: Classification And Regression Trees. CART is a method of splitting the independent variables into small groups and fitting a constant function to the small data sets. In categorical trees, the constant function is one that takes on a finite small set of values (e.g., Y or N, low or medium or high). In regression trees, the mean value of the response is fit to small connected data sets.
definition_uz: Tasniflash va regressiya daraxtlari. CART - mustaqil o'zgaruvchilarni kichik guruhlarga bo'lish va kichik ma'lumotlar to'plamlariga doimiy funktsiyani o'rnatish usuli. Kategoriyali daraxtlarda doimiy funktsiya chekli kichik qiymatlar to'plamini (masalan, Y yoki N, past yoki o'rta yoki yuqori) qabul qiladigan funktsiyadir. Regressiya daraxtlarida javobning qiymati kichik bog'langan ma'lumotlar to'plamlariga mos keladi.

definition_eng: Categorical data fits into a small number of discrete categories (as opposed to continuous). Categorical data is either non-ordered (nominal) such as gender or city, or ordered (ordinal) such as high, medium, or low temperatures.
definition_uz: Kategorik ma'lumotlar oz sonli diskret toifalarga mos keladi (uzluksiz ma'lumotlardan farqli o'laroq). Kategorik ma'lumotlar jins yoki shahar kabi tartibsiz (nominal) yoki yuqori, o'rta yoki past haroratlar kabi tartiblangan (tartibli) bo'ladi.

definition_eng: An algorithm for fitting categorical trees. It relies on the chi-squared statistic to split the data into small connected data sets.
definition_uz: Kategoriyali daraxtlarni o'rnatish algoritmi. U ma'lumotlarni kichik bog'langan ma'lumotlar to'plamlariga bo'lish uchun chi-kvadrat statistikasiga tayanadi.

definition_eng: A statistic that assesses how well a model fits the data. In data mining, it is most commonly used to find homogeneous subsets for fitting categorical trees as in CHAID.
definition_uz: Model ma'lumotlarga qanchalik mos kelishini baholaydigan statistik ma'lumot. Ma'lumotni intellektual tahlil qilishda u CHAIDda bo'lgani kabi toifali daraxtlarni o'rnatish uchun bir hil kichik to'plamlarni topish uchun eng ko'p qo'llaniladi.

definition_eng: Refers to the data mining problem of attempting to predict the category of categorical data by building a model based on some predictor variables.
definition_uz: Ba'zi bashorat qiluvchi o'zgaruvchilarga asoslangan modelni yaratish orqali toifali ma'lumotlar toifasini bashorat qilishga urinishdagi ma'lumotlarni intellektual tahlil qilish  muammosiga ishora qiladi.

definition_eng: A decision tree that places categorical variables into classes.
definition_uz: Kategorik o'zgaruvchilarni sinflarga joylashtiradigan qarorlar daraxti.

definition_eng: Clustering algorithms find groups of items that are similar. For example, clustering could be used by an insurance company to group customers according to income, age, types of policies purchased and prior claims experience. It divides a data set so that records with similar content are in the same group, and groups are as different as possible from each other. Since the categories are unspecified, this is sometimes referred to as unsupervised learning.
definition_uz: Klasterlash algoritmlari o'xshash elementlar guruhlarini topadi. Masalan, klasterlash sug'urta kompaniyasi tomonidan mijozlarni daromadlari, yoshi, sotib olingan polis turlari va oldingi da'volar tajribasiga ko'ra guruhlash uchun ishlatilishi mumkin. U o'xshash tarkibga ega yozuvlar bir guruhda bo'lishi uchun ma'lumotlar to'plamini ajratadi va guruhlar bir-biridan imkon qadar farq qiladi. Kategoriyalar aniqlanmaganligi sababli, bu ba'zan nazoratsiz o'rganish deb ataladi.

definition_eng: Confidence of rule “B given A” is a measure of how much more likely it is that B occurs when A has occurred. It is expressed as a percentage, with 100% meaning B always occurs if A has occurred. Statisticians refer to this as the conditional probability of B given A. When used with association rules, the term confidence is observational rather than predictive. (Statisticians also use this term in an unrelated way. There are ways to estimate an interval and the probability that the interval contains the true value of a parameter is called the interval confidence. So a 95% confidence interval for the mean has a probability of .95 of covering the true value of the mean.)
definition_uz: “B berilgan A” qoidasining ishonchi bu A sodir bo'lganda B sodir bo'lish ehtimoli qanchalik yuqori ekanligini ko'rsatadigan o'lchovdir. U foiz sifatida ifodalanadi, 100% degani, agar A sodir bo'lsa, B har doim sodir bo'ladi. Statistikachilar buni A berilgan B ning shartli ehtimoli deb atashadi. Assotsiatsiya qoidalari bilan foydalanilganda ishonch atamasi bashorat qilishdan ko'ra kuzatishga asoslangan. (Statistiklar bu atamani ham bir-biri bilan bog‘lanmagan holda ishlatishadi. Intervalni baholash usullari mavjud va oraliq parametrning haqiqiy qiymatini o‘z ichiga olishi ehtimoli oraliq ishonchi deb ataladi. Demak, o‘rtacha qiymat uchun 95% ishonch oralig‘i quyidagi ehtimollikka ega. O'rtachaning haqiqiy qiymatini qoplashning .95 i.)

definition_eng: A confusion matrix shows the counts of the actual versus predicted class values. It shows not only how well the model predicts, but also presents the details needed to see exactly where things may have gone wrong.
definition_uz: Chalkashlik matritsasi haqiqiy va bashorat qilingan sinf qiymatlarining sonlarini ko'rsatadi. U nafaqat model qanchalik yaxshi bashorat qilishini ko'rsatadi, balki qayerda noto'g'ri bo'lishi mumkinligini aniq ko'rish uchun zarur bo'lgan tafsilotlarni ham taqdim etadi.

definition_eng: When an association between two variables is defined, the second item (or right-hand side) is called the consequent. For example, in the relationship “When a prospector buys a pick, he buys a shovel 14% of the time,” “buys a shovel” is the consequent.
definition_uz: Ikki o'zgaruvchi o'rtasidagi assotsiatsiya aniqlanganda, ikkinchi element (yoki o'ng tomon) natija deb ataladi. Misol uchun, munosabatlarda "Qizdiruvchi bolg'a sotib olayotganda

definition_eng: Continuous data can have any value in an interval of real numbers. That is, the value does not have to be an integer. Continuous is the opposite of discrete or categorical.nbsp;
definition_uz: Doimiy   ma'lumotlar haqiqiy sonlar oralig'ida istalgan qiymatga ega bo'lishi mumkin. Ya'ni, qiymat butun son bo'lishi shart emas. Continous - diskret yoki categorical.nbsp ning teskarisi;

definition_eng: A method of estimating the accuracy of a classification or regression model. The data set is divided into several parts, with each part in turn used to test a model fitted to the remaining parts.
definition_uz: Tasniflash yoki regressiya modelining aniqligini baholash usuli. Ma'lumotlar to'plami bir necha qismlarga bo'linadi, ularning har biri o'z navbatida qolgan qismlarga o'rnatilgan modelni sinab ko'rish uchun ishlatiladi.

definition_eng: Values collected through record keeping or by polling, observing, or measuring, typically organized for analysis or decision making. More simply, data is facts, transactions and figures.
definition_uz: Hisobga olish yoki so'rov, kuzatish yoki o'lchash yo'li bilan to'plangan qiymatlar, odatda tahlil qilish yoki qaror qabul qilish uchun tashkil etiladi. Oddiy qilib aytganda, ma'lumotlar faktlar, operatsiyalar va raqamlardir.

definition_eng: Data items can exist in many formats such as text, integer and floating-point decimal. Data format refers to the form of the data in the database.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar elementlari matn, butun va  o'nli kasr kabi ko'plab formatlarda mavjud bo'lishi mumkin. Ma'lumotlar formati ma'lumotlar bazasidagi ma'lumotlar shaklini anglatadi.

definition_eng: An information extraction activity whose goal is to discover hidden facts contained in databases. Using a combination of machine learning, statistical analysis, modeling techniques and database technology, data mining finds patterns and subtle relationships in data and infers rules that allow the prediction of future results. Typical applications include market segmentation, customer profiling, fraud detection, evaluation of retail promotions, and credit risk analysis.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar bazasidagi yashirin faktlarni aniqlash maqsadi bo'lgan ma'lumot olish faoliyati. Mashinani o'rganish, statistik tahlil, modellashtirish texnikasi va ma'lumotlar bazasi texnologiyasi kombinatsiyasidan foydalangan holda, ma'lumotlarni intellektual tahlil qilish ma'lumotlarda namuna va nozik munosabatlarni topadi va kelajakdagi natijalarni bashorat qilishga imkon beruvchi qoidalarni aniqlaydi. Odatiy ilovalar orasida bozor segmentatsiyasi, mijozlarning profilini aniqlash, firibgarlikni aniqlash, chakana reklama aktsiyalarini baholash va kredit riskini tahlil qilish kiradi.

definition_eng: Procedures and algorithms designed to analyze the data in databases.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar bazalaridagi ma'lumotlarni tahlil qilish uchun mo'ljallangan protseduralar va algoritmlar.

definition_eng: Database management systems.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar bazasini boshqarish tizimlari.

definition_eng: A tree-like way of representing a collection of hierarchical rules that lead to a class or value.
definition_uz: Sinf yoki qiymatga olib keladigan ierarxik qoidalar to'plamini ifodalashning daraxtga o'xshash usuli.

definition_eng: Deduction infers information that is a logical consequence of the data.
definition_uz: Deduktsiya ma'lumotlarning mantiqiy natijasi bo'lgan ma'lumotlarni chiqaradi.

definition_eng: A measure of how closely the model fits the training data. A common measure is r-square.
definition_uz: Modelning ta'lim ma'lumotlariga qanchalik mos kelishining o'lchovi. Umumiy o'lchovi r-kvadrat.

definition_eng: The dependent variables (outputs or responses) of a model are the variables predicted by the equation or rules of the model using the independent variables (inputs or predictors).
definition_uz: Modelning qaram o'zgaruvchilari (chiqish yoki javoblar) mustaqil o'zgaruvchilar (kirishlar yoki bashorat qiluvchilar) yordamida modelning tenglamasi yoki qoidalari bilan bashorat qilingan o'zgaruvchilardir.

definition_eng: After the model is trained and validated, it is used to analyze new data and make predictions. This use of the model is called deployment.
definition_uz: Model o'qitilgan va tasdiqlangandan so'ng, u yangi ma'lumotlarni tahlil qilish va bashorat qilish uchun ishlatiladi. Modeldan bunday foydalanish joylashtirish deb ataladi.

definition_eng: Each attribute of a case or occurrence in the data being mined. Stored as a field in a flat file record or a column of relational database table.
definition_uz: Tahrir qilinayotgan ma'lumotlardagi holat yoki hodisaning har bir atributi. Yassi fayl yozuvida yoki relyatsion ma'lumotlar bazasi jadvalining ustunida maydon sifatida saqlanadi.

definition_eng: A data item that has a finite set of values. Discrete is the opposite of continuous.
definition_uz: Cheklangan qiymatlar to'plamiga ega bo'lgan ma'lumotlar elementi. Diskret uzluksizga qarama-qarshidir.

definition_eng: A statistical method based on maximum likelihood for determining boundaries that separate the data into categories.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlarni toifalarga ajratadigan chegaralarni aniqlashning maksimal ehtimoliga asoslangan statistik usul.

definition_eng: A way to measure variability other than the variance statistic. Some decision trees split the data into groups based on minimum entropy.
definition_uz: Dispersiya statistikasidan tashqari o'zgaruvchanlikni o'lchash usuli. Ba'zi qaror daraxtlari ma'lumotlarni minimal entropiya asosida guruhlarga ajratadi.

definition_eng: Looking at data to discover relationships not previously detected. Exploratory analysis tools typically assist the user in creating tables and graphical displays.
definition_uz: Ilgari aniqlanmagan munosabatlarni aniqlash uchun ma'lumotlarni ko'rib chiqish. Eksperimental tahlil vositalari odatda foydalanuvchiga jadvallar va grafik displeylarni yaratishda yordam beradi.

definition_eng: Data not collected by the organization, such as data available from a reference book, a government source or a proprietary database.
definition_uz: Tashkilot tomonidan to'planmagan ma'lumotlar, masalan, ma'lumotnoma, davlat manbasi yoki mulkiy ma'lumotlar bazasidan olingan ma'lumotlar.

definition_eng: A neural net in which the signals only flow in one direction, from the inputs to the outputs.
definition_uz: Signallar faqat bitta yo'nalishda, kirishdan chiqishgacha oqadigan neyron tarmoq.

definition_eng: A computer-based method of generating and testing combinations of possible input parameters to find the optimal output. It uses processes based on natural evolution concepts such as genetic combination, mutation and natural selection.
definition_uz: Optimal natijani topish uchun mumkin bo'lgan kirish parametrlarining kombinatsiyalarini yaratish va sinovdan o'tkazishning kompyuterga asoslangan usuli. U genetik birikma, mutatsiya va tabiiy tanlanish kabi tabiiy evolyutsiya tushunchalariga asoslangan jarayonlardan foydalanadi.

definition_eng: Graphical User Interface.
definition_uz: Grafik foydalanuvchi interfeysi.

definition_eng: The nodes in the hidden layers in a neural net. Unlike input and output nodes, the number of hidden nodes is not predetermined. The accuracy of the resulting model is affected by the number of hidden nodes. Since the number of hidden nodes directly affects the number of parameters in the model, a neural net needs a sufficient number of hidden nodes to enable it to properly model the underlying behavior. On the other hand, a net with too many hidden nodes will overfit the data. Some neural net products include algorithms that search over a number of alternative neural nets by varying the number of hidden nodes, in the end choosing the model that gets the best results without overfitting.
definition_uz: Neyron tarmog'idagi yashirin qatlamlardagi tugunlar. Kirish va chiqish tugunlaridan farqli o'laroq, yashirin tugunlar soni oldindan belgilanmagan. Olingan modelning aniqligi yashirin tugunlar soniga ta'sir qiladi. Yashirin tugunlar soni to'g'ridan-to'g'ri modeldagi parametrlar soniga ta'sir qilganligi sababli, neyron tarmoq asosiy xatti-harakatni to'g'ri modellashtirish uchun etarli miqdordagi yashirin tugunlarga muhtoj. Boshqa tomondan, juda ko'p yashirin tugunlarga ega bo'lgan tarmoq ma'lumotlarga mos keladi. Ba'zi neyron tarmoq mahsulotlari yashirin tugunlar sonini o'zgartirish orqali bir qator muqobil neyron tarmoqlarni qidiradigan algoritmlarni o'z ichiga oladi va oxirida ortiqcha moslamasiz eng yaxshi natijalarni oladigan modelni tanlaydi.

definition_eng: The independent variables (inputs or predictors) of a model are the variables used in the equation or rules of the model to predict the output (dependent) variable.
definition_uz: Modelning mustaqil o'zgaruvchilari (kirishlar yoki bashorat qiluvchilar) chiqish (qaram) o'zgaruvchini bashorat qilish uchun modelning tenglamasi yoki qoidalarida ishlatiladigan o'zgaruvchilardir.

definition_eng: A technique that infers generalizations from the information in the data.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlardagi ma'lumotlardan umumiy xulosalar chiqaradigan texnika.

definition_eng: Two independent variables interact when changes in the value of one change the effect on the dependent variable of the other.
definition_uz: Ikki mustaqil o'zgaruvchi o'zaro ta'sir qiladi, agar birining qiymatining o'zgarishi boshqasining bog'liq o'zgaruvchisiga ta'sirini o'zgartirsa.

definition_eng: Data collected by an organization such as operating and customer data.
definition_uz: Operatsion va mijozlar ma'lumotlari kabi tashkilot tomonidan to'plangan ma'lumotlar.

definition_eng: A classification method that classifies a point by calculating the distances between the point and points in the training data set. Then it assigns the point to the class that is most common among its k-nearest neighbors (where k is an integer).
definition_uz: O'quv ma'lumotlar to'plamidagi nuqta va nuqtalar orasidagi masofani hisoblash orqali nuqtani tasniflaydigan tasniflash usuli. Keyin u k-eng yaqin qo'shnilari orasida eng keng tarqalgan nuqtani sinfga belgilaydi (bu erda k - butun son).

definition_eng: A type of neural network that uses unsupervised learning to find patterns in data. In data mining it is employed for cluster analysis.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlardagi naqshlarni topish uchun nazoratsiz o'rganishdan foydalanadigan neyron tarmoq turi. Ma'lumotlarni intellektual tahlil qilishda  u klaster tahlili uchun ishlatiladi.

definition_eng: Nodes in a neural net are usually grouped into layers, with each layer described as input, output or hidden. There are as many input nodes as there are input (independent) variables and as many output nodes as there are output (dependent) variables. Typically, there are one or two hidden layers.
definition_uz: Neyron tarmog'idagi tugunlar odatda qatlamlarga guruhlanadi, har bir qatlam kirish, chiqish yoki yashirin sifatida tavsiflanadi. Kirish (mustaqil) o'zgaruvchilar qancha bo'lsa, shuncha ko'p kirish tugunlari va chiqish (bog'liq) o'zgaruvchilari shunchalik ko'p chiqish tugunlari mavjud. Odatda, bir yoki ikkita yashirin qatlam mavjud.

definition_eng: A node not further split — the terminal grouping — in a classification or decision tree.
definition_uz: Keyinchalik bo'linmagan tugun - terminallar guruhi - tasniflash yoki qarorlar qabul qilish  daraxtida.

definition_eng: Training models (estimating their parameters) based on existing data.
definition_uz: Mavjud ma'lumotlar asosida o'qitish modellari (ularning parametrlarini baholash).

definition_eng: The most common method of training (estimating) the weights (parameters) of a model by choosing the weights that minimize the sum of the squared deviation of the predicted values of the model from the observed values of the data.
definition_uz: Modelning og'irliklarini (parametrlarini) o'qitishning (baholashning) eng keng tarqalgan usuli - bu modelning taxmin qilingan qiymatlarining kvadratik og'ish yig'indisini ma'lumotlarning kuzatilgan qiymatlaridan minimallashtiradigan og'irliklarni tanlash.

definition_eng: A generalization of linear regression. It is used for predicting a binary variable (with values such as yes/no or 0/1). An example of its use is modeling the odds that a borrower will default on a loan based on the borrower’s income, debt and age.
definition_uz: Chiziqli regressiyani umumlashtirish. U ikkilik o'zgaruvchini bashorat qilish uchun ishlatiladi (ha/yo'q yoki 0/1 kabi qiymatlar bilan). Qarz oluvchining daromadi, qarzi va yoshiga qarab qarz oluvchining qarzni to'lamaslik ehtimolini modellashtirish undan foydalanishga misol bo'ladi.

definition_eng: Multivariate Adaptive Regression Splines
definition_uz: Ko'p o'zgaruvchan adaptiv regressiya splinelari

definition_eng: Another training or estimation method. The maximum likelihood estimate of a parameter is the value of a parameter that maximizes the probability that the data came from the population defined by the parameter.
definition_uz: Boshqa ta'lim yoki baholash usuli. Parametrning maksimal ehtimollik bahosi - bu parametr tomonidan aniqlangan populyatsiyadan ma'lumotlar kelishi ehtimolini maksimal darajada oshiradigan parametr qiymati.

definition_eng: The arithmetic average value of a collection of numeric data.
definition_uz: Raqamli ma'lumotlar to'plamining o'rtacha arifmetik qiymati.

definition_eng: The value in the middle of a collection of ordered data. In other words, the value with the same number of items above and below it.
definition_uz: Buyurtma qilingan ma'lumotlar to'plamining o'rtasida joylashgan qiymat. Boshqacha qilib aytganda, yuqorida va pastda bir xil miqdordagi elementlarga ega qiymat.

definition_eng: Data values can be missing because they were not measured, not answered, were unknown or were lost. Data mining methods vary in the way they treat missing values. Typically, they ignore the missing values, or omit any records containing missing values, or replace missing values with the mode or mean, or infer missing values from existing values.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar qiymatlari yetishmayotgan bo'lishi mumkin, chunki ular o'lchanmagan, javob berilmagan, noma'lum yoki yo'qolgan. Ma'lumotni intellektual tahlil qilish  usullari yetishmayotgan qiymatlarni topish  usulida farqlanadi. Odatda, ular yetishmayotgan qiymatlarni e'tiborsiz qoldiradilar yoki yetishmayotgan qiymatlarni o'z ichiga olgan har qanday yozuvlarni o'tkazib yuboradilar yoki yetishmayotgan qiymatlarni rejim yoki o'rtacha bilan almashtiradilar yoki mavjud qiymatlardan yetishmayotgan qiymatlarni chiqaradilar.

definition_eng: The most common value in a data set. If more than one value occurs the same number of times, the data is multi-modal.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar to'plamidagi eng keng tarqalgani qiymat. Agar bir nechta qiymatlar bir xil sonda sodir bo'lsa, ma'lumotlar multimodaldir.

definition_eng: An important function of data mining is the production of a model. A model can be descriptive or predictive. A descriptive model helps in understanding underlying processes or behavior. For example, an association model describes consumer behavior. A predictive model is an equation or set of rules that makes it possible to predict an unseen or unmeasured value (the dependent variable or output) from other, known values (independent variables or input). The form of the equation or rules is suggested by mining data collected from the process under study. Some training or estimation technique is used to estimate the parameters of the equation or rules.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotni intellektual tahlil qilishning muhim funktsiyasi bu modelni ishlab chiqarishdir. Model tavsiflovchi yoki bashorat qiluvchi bo'lishi mumkin. Ta'riflovchi model asosiy jarayonlar yoki xatti-harakatlarni tushunishga yordam beradi. Masalan, assotsiatsiya modeli iste'molchi xatti-harakatlarini tavsiflaydi. Bashoratli model - bu boshqa ma'lum qiymatlardan (mustaqil o'zgaruvchilar yoki kirishlar) ko'rinmaydigan yoki o'lchanmagan qiymatni (qaram o'zgaruvchi yoki chiqish) bashorat qilish imkonini beruvchi tenglama yoki qoidalar to'plami. Tenglama yoki qoidalarning shakli o'rganilayotgan jarayondan to'plangan tahlil qilingan ma'lumotlari bilan taklif qilinadi. Tenglama yoki qoidalarning parametrlarini baholash uchun ba'zi o'qitish yoki baholash texnikasi qo'llaniladi.

definition_eng: Massively parallel processing, a computer configuration that is able to use hundreds or thousands of CPUs simultaneously. In MPP each node may be a single CPU or a collection of SMP CPUs. An MPP collection of SMP nodes is sometimes called an SMP cluster. Each node has its own copy of the operating system, memory, and disk storage, and there is a data or process exchange mechanism so that each computer can work on a different part of a problem. Software must be written specifically to take advantage of this architecture.
definition_uz: Massiv parallel ishlov berish, bir vaqtning o'zida yuzlab yoki minglab protsessorlardan foydalanishga qodir bo'lgan kompyuter konfiguratsiyasi. MPP da har bir tugun bitta protsessor yoki SMP protsessorlari to'plami bo'lishi mumkin. SMP tugunlarining MPP to'plami ba'zan SMP klasteri deb ataladi. Har bir tugun operatsion tizim, xotira va disk xotirasining o'ziga xos nusxasiga ega bo'lib, har bir kompyuter muammoning boshqa qismida ishlashi uchun ma'lumotlar yoki jarayonlar almashinuvi mexanizmi mavjud. Ushbu arxitekturadan foydalanish uchun dasturiy ta'minot maxsus yozilishi kerak.

definition_eng:
A complex nonlinear modeling technique based on a model of a human neuron. A neural net is used to predict outputs (dependent
variables) from a set of inputs (independent variables) by taking linear combinations of the inputs and then making nonlinear transformations of the linear combinations using an activation function. It can be shown theoretically that such combinations and transformations can approximate virtually any type of response function. Thus, neural nets use large numbers of parameters to approximate any model. Neural nets are often applied to predict future outcome based on prior experience. For example, a neural net application could be used to predict who will respond to a direct mailing.
definition_uz:
Inson neyronining modeliga asoslangan murakkab chiziqli bo'lmagan modellashtirish texnikasi. Neyron tarmog'i natijalarni bashorat qilish uchun ishlatiladi (qaram
o'zgaruvchilar) kirishlar to'plamidan (mustaqil o'zgaruvchilar) kirishlarning chiziqli birikmalarini olish va keyin faollashtirish funktsiyasidan foydalangan holda chiziqli birikmalarning chiziqli bo'lmagan o'zgarishlarini amalga oshirish. Nazariy jihatdan shuni ko'rsatish mumkinki, bunday birikmalar va o'zgarishlar deyarli har qanday turdagi javob funktsiyasiga mos kelishi mumkin. Shunday qilib, neyron tarmoqlar har qanday modelga yaqinlashish uchun ko'p sonli parametrlardan foydalanadi. Neyron tarmoqlari ko'pincha oldingi tajribaga asoslangan kelajakdagi natijalarni bashorat qilish uchun qo'llaniladi. Masalan, neyron tarmog'i ilovasi to'g'ridan-to'g'ri xabarga kim javob berishini taxmin qilish uchun ishlatilishi mumkin.

definition_eng: A decision point in a classification (i.e., decision) tree. Also, a point in a neural net that combines input from other nodes and produces an output through application of an activation function.
definition_uz: Tasniflash (ya'ni, qaror) daraxtidagi qaror nuqtasi. Shuningdek, neyron tarmog'idagi nuqta, u boshqa tugunlardan kirishni birlashtiradi va faollashtirish funktsiyasini qo'llash orqali chiqadi.

definition_eng: The difference between a model and its predictions. Sometimes data is referred to as noisy when it contains errors such as many missing or incorrect values or when there are extraneous columns.
definition_uz: Model va uning bashoratlari o'rtasidagi farq. Ba'zan ma'lumotlar ko'p yetishmayotgan yoki noto'g'ri qiymatlar kabi xatolarni o'z ichiga olgan yoki begona ustunlar mavjud bo'lsa, shovqinli deb ataladi.

definition_eng: Missing values that would be logically impossible (e.g., pregnant males) or are obviously not relevant.
definition_uz: Mantiqan imkonsiz bo'lgan (masalan, homilador erkaklar) yoki aniq ahamiyatsiz bo'lgan  yetishmayotgan qiymatlar .

definition_eng: A collection of numeric data is normalized by subtracting the minimum value from all values and dividing by the range of the data. This yields data with a similarly shaped histogram but with all values between 0 and 1. It is useful to do this for all inputs into neural nets and also for inputs into other regression models. (Also see standardize.)
definition_uz: Raqamli ma'lumotlar to'plami barcha qiymatlardan minimal qiymatni ayirish va ma'lumotlar diapazoniga bo'lish orqali normallashtiriladi. Bu xuddi shunday shakldagi gistogrammaga ega, ammo barcha qiymatlari 0 dan 1 gacha bo'lgan ma'lumotlarni beradi. Buni neyron tarmoqlarga barcha kiritishlar va boshqa regressiya modellariga kirishlar uchun qilish foydalidir. (Shuningdek standartlashtirishga qarang.)

definition_eng: On-Line Analytical Processing tools give the user the capability to perform multi-dimensional analysis of the data.
definition_uz: Onlayn tahliliy ishlov berish vositalari foydalanuvchiga ma'lumotlarni ko'p o'lchovli tahlil qilish imkoniyatini beradi.

definition_eng: A positive function of the difference between predictions and data estimates that are chosen so as to optimize the function or criterion. Least squares and maximum likelihood are examples.
definition_uz: Funktsiya yoki mezonni optimallashtirish uchun tanlangan bashoratlar va ma'lumotlar taxminlari o'rtasidagi farqning ijobiy funktsiyasi. Eng kichik kvadratlar va maksimal ehtimollik misollardir.

definition_eng: Technically, outliers are data items that did not (or are thought not to have) come from the assumed population of data — for example, a non-numeric when you are expecting only numeric values. A more casual usage refers to data items that fall outside the boundaries that enclose most other data items in the data set.
definition_uz: Texnik jihatdan, chetga chiqqanlar - bu taxminiy ma'lumotlar to'plamidan kelib chiqmagan (yoki yo'q deb hisoblangan) ma'lumotlar elementlari - masalan, siz faqat raqamli qiymatlarni kutayotganingizda raqamli bo'lmagan ma'lumotdir. Ko'proq tasodifiy foydalanish ma'lumotlar to'plamidagi boshqa ko'plab ma'lumotlar elementlarini qamrab oladigan chegaralardan tashqarida joylashgan ma'lumotlar elementlarini anglatadi.

definition_eng: A tendency of some modeling techniques to assign importance to random variations in the data by declaring them important patterns.
definition_uz: Ba'zi modellashtirish usullarining ma'lumotlardagi tasodifiy o'zgarishlarga muhim qismlarini e'lon qilish orqali ahamiyat berish tendentsiyasi.

definition_eng: Data not collected by the organization, such as data from a proprietary database, that is combined with the organization’s own data.
definition_uz: Tashkilot tomonidan yig'ilmagan ma'lumotlar, masalan, xususiy ma'lumotlar bazasidan olingan ma'lumotlar, tashkilotning o'z ma'lumotlari bilan birlashtirilgan.

definition_eng: Several computers or CPUs linked together so that each can be computing simultaneously.
definition_uz: Bir nechta kompyuterlar yoki protsessorlar bir-biriga bog'langan, shuning uchun har biri bir vaqtning o'zida hisoblashi mumkin.

definition_eng: Analysts and statisticians spend much of their time looking for patterns in data. A pattern can be a relationship between two variables. Data mining techniques include automatic pattern discovery that makes it possible to detect complicated non-linear relationships in data. Patterns are not the same as causality.
definition_uz: Tahlilchilar va statistiklar ko'p vaqtlarini ma'lumotlar namunalarini izlashga sarflashadi. Shakl ikki o'zgaruvchi o'rtasidagi munosabat bo'lishi mumkin. Ma'lumotni intellektual tahlil qilish usullari ma'lumotlardagi murakkab chiziqli bo'lmagan munosabatlarni aniqlash imkonini beradigan avtomatik namunalarni aniqlashni o'z ichiga oladi. Namunalar  sababiy bog'liqlik bilan bir xil emas.

definition_eng: The precision of an estimate of a parameter in a model is a measure of how variable the estimate would be over other similar data sets. A very precise estimate would be one that did not vary much over different data sets. Precision does not measure accuracy. Accuracy is a measure of how close the estimate is to the real value of the parameter. Accuracy is measured by the average distance over different data sets of the estimate from the real value. Estimates can be accurate but not precise, or precise but not accurate. A precise but inaccurate estimate is usually biased, with the bias equal to the average distance from the real value of the parameter
definition_uz: Modeldagi parametrni baholashning aniqligi taxminning boshqa shunga o'xshash ma'lumotlar to'plamlariga nisbatan qanchalik o'zgaruvchan bo'lishining o'lchovidir. Turli ma'lumotlar to'plamlarida unchalik farq qilmaydigan juda aniq taxmin bo'ladi. Aniqlik aniqlikni o'lchamaydi. Aniqlik - bu taxminning parametrning haqiqiy qiymatiga qanchalik yaqinligini ko'rsatadigan o'lchovdir. Aniqlik turli xil ma'lumotlar to'plamlari bo'yicha haqiqiy qiymatdan o'rtacha masofa bilan o'lchanadi. Hisob-kitoblar to'g'ri bo'lishi mumkin, ammo aniq emas yoki aniq, ammo aniq bo'lmasligi mumkin. Aniq, ammo noto'g'ri baholash odatda ob'ektiv bo'lib, parametrning haqiqiy qiymatidan o'rtacha masofaga teng.

definition_eng: Some data mining vendors use predictability of associations or sequences to mean the same as confidence.
definition_uz: Ba'zi ma'lumotlarni ishlab chiqaruvchi sotuvchilar ishonch bilan bir xil ma'noni anglatish uchun uyushmalar yoki ketma-ketliklarning bashorat qilinishidan foydalanadilar.

definition_eng: The measure of how often the collection of items in an association occur together as a percentage of all the transactions. For example, “In 2% of the purchases at the hardware store, both a pick and a shovel were bought.”
definition_uz: Assotsiatsiyadagi elementlarni yig'ish qanchalik tez-tez sodir bo'lishini o'lchovi barcha operatsiyalarning foizi sifatida. Masalan, "Uskunalar do'konidagi xaridlarning 2 foizida bolg'a  ham

definition_eng: The range of the data is the difference between the maximum value and the minimum value. Alternatively, range can include the minimum and maximum, as in “The value ranges from 2 to 8.”
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar diapazoni maksimal qiymat va minimal qiymat o'rtasidagi farqdir. Shu bilan bir qatorda, diapazon "Qiymat 2 dan 8 gacha"" dagi kabi minimal va maksimalni o'z ichiga olishi mumkin."

definition_eng: Relational Database Management System.
definition_uz: Relyatsion ma'lumotlar bazasini boshqarish tizimi.

definition_eng: A decision tree that predicts values of continuous variables.
definition_uz: Uzluksiz o'zgaruvchilar qiymatlarini bashorat qiluvchi qarorlar  qabul qilish daraxti.

definition_eng: The same as association, except that the time sequence of events is also considered. For example, “Twenty percent of the people who buy a VCR buy a camcorder within four months.”
definition_uz: Assotsiatsiya bilan bir xil, bundan tashqari voqealarning vaqt ketma-ketligi ham hisobga olinadi. Misol uchun, "VCR sotib olgan odamlarning yigirma foizi to'rt oy ichida videokamera sotib oladi."""

definition_eng: A probability measure of how strongly the data support a certain result (usually of a statistical test). If the significance of a result is said to be .05, it means that there is only a .05 probability that the result could have happened by chance alone. Very low significance (less than .05) is usually taken as evidence that the data mining model should be accepted since events with very low probability seldom occur. So if the estimate of a parameter in a model showed a significance of .01 that would be evidence that the parameter must be in the model.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlarning ma'lum bir natijani qanchalik qo'llab-quvvatlashi ehtimoli o'lchovi (odatda statistik test). Agar natijaning ahamiyati .05 deb aytilsa, bu natija faqat tasodifan sodir bo'lishi mumkin bo'lgan ehtimollik faqat .05 ekanligini anglatadi. Juda kam ahamiyatlilik (.05 dan kam) odatda ma'lumotlarni yig'ish modeli qabul qilinishi kerakligiga dalil sifatida qabul qilinadi, chunki juda kam ehtimollikdagi hodisalar kamdan-kam sodir bo'ladi. Shunday qilib, agar modeldagi parametrni baholash .01 ahamiyatliligini ko'rsatsa, bu parametr modelda bo'lishi kerakligidan dalolat beradi.

definition_eng: The collection of techniques where analysis uses a well-defined (known) dependent variable. All regression and classification techniques are supervised.
definition_uz: Tahlil aniq belgilangan (ma'lum) qaram o'zgaruvchidan foydalanadigan usullar to'plami. Barcha regressiya va tasniflash usullari nazorat qilinadi.

definition_eng: A data set independent of the training data set, used to fine-tune the estimates of the model parameters (i.e., weights).
definition_uz: O'quv ma'lumotlar to'plamidan mustaqil ma'lumotlar to'plami, model parametrlarini (ya'ni, og'irliklar) aniq sozlash uchun foydalaniladi.

definition_eng: The estimate of error based on the difference between the predictions of a model on a test data set and the observed values in the test data set when the test data set was not used to train the model.
definition_uz: Sinov ma'lumotlari to'plamida modelni bashorat qilish va test ma'lumotlar to'plamida kuzatilgan qiymatlar o'rtasidagi farqga asoslangan xatoni baholash, agar test ma'lumotlar to'plami modelni o'qitish uchun ishlatilmagan bo'lsa.

definition_eng: A series of measurements taken at consecutive points in time. Data mining products which handle time series incorporate time-related operators such as moving average.
definition_uz: Vaqtning ketma-ket nuqtalarida olingan bir qator o'lchovlar. Vaqt ketma-ketligini ko'rib chiqadigan ma'lumotlarni qidirish mahsulotlari harakatlanuvchi o'rtacha kabi vaqt bilan bog'liq operatorlarni o'z ichiga oladi.

definition_eng: This term refers to the collection of techniques where groupings of the data are defined without the use of a dependent variable. Cluster analysis is an example.
definition_uz: Ushbu atama ma'lumotlarning guruhlari bog'liq o'zgaruvchidan foydalanmasdan aniqlangan texnikalar to'plamini anglatadi. Klaster tahlili misol bo'la oladi.

definition_eng: The process of testing the models with a data set different from the training data set.
definition_uz: Modellarni o'quv ma'lumotlar to'plamidan farqli ma'lumotlar to'plami bilan sinovdan o'tkazish jarayoni.

definition_eng: Visualization tools graphically display data to facilitate better understanding of its meaning. Graphical capabilities range from simple scatter plots to complex multi-dimensional representations.
definition_uz: Vizualizatsiya vositalari uning ma'nosini yaxshiroq tushunish uchun ma'lumotlarni grafik tarzda aks ettiradi. Grafik imkoniyatlar oddiy tarqalish chizmalaridan tortib murakkab ko'p o'lchovli tasvirlargacha.

definition_eng: An algorithm is a set of instructions or rules designed to solve a definite problem. The problem can be simple like adding two numbers or a complex one, such as converting a video file from one format to another
definition_uz: Algoritm - bu aniq masalani hal qilish uchun mo'ljallangan ko'rsatmalar yoki qoidalar to'plami. Muammo ikkita raqam yoki murakkab raqam qo'shish kabi oddiy bo'lishi mumkin, masalan, video faylni bir formatdan boshqasiga o'tkazish.

definition_eng: A computer program is termed as an organized collection of instructions, which when executed perform a specific task or function. A program is processed by the central processing unit (CPU) of the computer before it is executed. An example of a program is Microsoft Word, which is a word processing application that enables users to create and edit documents. The browsers that we use are also programs created to help us browse the internet.
definition_uz: Kompyuter dasturi bajarilganda ma'lum bir vazifa yoki funktsiyani bajaradigan ko'rsatmalarning uyushgan to'plami deb ataladi. Dastur bajarilishidan oldin kompyuterning markaziy protsessor (CPU) tomonidan qayta ishlanadi. Dasturga misol qilib, foydalanuvchilarga hujjatlarni yaratish va tahrirlash imkonini beruvchi so'zlarni qayta ishlash dasturi bo'lgan Microsoft Word dasturini keltirish mumkin. Biz foydalanadigan brauzerlar ham internetni kezishimizga yordam beradigan dasturlardir.

definition_eng: Application Programming Interface (API) is a set of rules, routines, and protocols to build software applications. APIs help in communication with third party programs or services, which can be used to build different software. Companies such as Facebook and Twitter actively use APIs to help developers gain easier access to their services.
definition_uz: Ilova  dasturlash interfeysi (API) - dasturiy ta'minotni yaratish uchun qoidalar, tartiblar va protokollar to'plami. API-lar turli xil dasturlarni yaratish uchun ishlatilishi mumkin bo'lgan uchinchi tomon dasturlari yoki xizmatlari bilan aloqa qilishda yordam beradi. Facebook va Twitter kabi kompaniyalar ishlab chiquvchilarga o'z xizmatlaridan osonroq foydalanishlariga yordam berish uchun API'lardan faol foydalanadilar.

definition_eng: Argument or arg is a value that is passed into a command or a function. For example, if SQR is a routine or function that returns the square of a number, then SQR(4) will return 16. Here, the value 4 is the argument. Similarly, if the edit is a function that edits a file, then in edit myfile.txt, ‘myfile.txt’ is the argument.
definition_uz: Argument yoki arg - bu buyruq yoki funktsiyaga o'tkaziladigan qiymat. Misol uchun, agar SQR raqam kvadratini qaytaruvchi tartib yoki funksiya bo'lsa, SQR(4) 16 ni qaytaradi. Bu erda 4 qiymati argumentdir. Xuddi shunday, agar tahrirlash faylni tahrirlovchi funksiya bo‘lsa, myfile.txt tahririda “myfile.txt” argument hisoblanadi.

definition_eng: A Boolean expression or Boolean logic is an expression used for creating statements that are either TRUE or FALSE. Boolean expressions use AND, OR, XOR, NOT and NOR operators with conditional statements in programming, search engines, algorithms, and formulas. Boolean expressions are also called comparison expressions, conditional expressions, and relational expressions.
definition_uz: Mantiqiy ifoda yoki mantiqiy mantiq - bu TRUE yoki FALSE bo'lgan bayonotlarni yaratish uchun ishlatiladigan ifoda. Mantiqiy ifodalar dasturlashda, qidiruv tizimlarida, algoritmlarda va formulalarda shartli bayonotlar bilan AND, OR, XOR, NOT va NOR operatorlaridan foydalanadi. Mantiqiy ifodalar taqqoslash ifodalari, shartli ifodalar va munosabat ifodalari deb ham ataladi.

definition_eng: A bug is a general term used to denote an unexpected error or defect in hardware or software, which causes it to malfunction. Even though bugs are often considered to be insignificant computer glitches, there have been instances where bugs have caused life-threatening conditions and led to major financial losses. This makes it imperative to invest in the process of finding bugs before programs are rolled out for their application. This process is known as testing.
definition_uz: Xato - bu apparat yoki dasturiy ta'minotdagi kutilmagan xato yoki nuqsonni bildirish uchun ishlatiladigan umumiy atama bo'lib, uning noto'g'ri ishlashiga olib keladi. Xatolar ko'pincha ahamiyatsiz kompyuter nosozliklari deb hisoblansa ham, xatolar hayot uchun xavfli vaziyatlarni keltirib chiqargan va katta moliyaviy yo'qotishlarga olib kelgan holatlar mavjud. Bu dasturlarni qo'llash uchun chiqarilishidan oldin xatolarni topish jarayoniga sarmoya kiritishni talab qiladi. Bu jarayon sinov sifatida tanilgan.

definition_eng: Character (char) is a display unit of information equal to one alphabetic letter or symbol. The value of a char variable could be any one character value, such as ‘a’, ‘1’, ‘$’ and ‘X’. This definition of character relies on the general definition of a character as a sole unit of written language. However, char as an abbreviation is a reserved keyword in languages such as C, C++, C#, and Java.
definition_uz: Belgi (char) - bitta alifbo harfi yoki belgiga teng bo'lgan ma'lumotni ko'rsatish birligi. Char o'zgaruvchisining qiymati "a""

definition_eng: An object is a combination of related variables, constants and other data structures which can be selected and manipulated together. An object can include shapes that appear on a screen or the age of students in a school.
definition_uz: Ob'ekt - bu o'zaro bog'liq o'zgaruvchilar, konstantalar va boshqa ma'lumotlar tuzilmalarining kombinatsiyasi bo'lib, ular birgalikda tanlanishi va boshqarilishi mumkin. Ob'ekt ekranda paydo bo'ladigan shakllarni yoki maktab o'quvchilarining yoshini o'z ichiga olishi mumkin.

definition_eng: Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a model defined by programmers that revolve around objects and data rather than ‘actions’ and ‘logic’. In OOP, not only the data type of a data structure is defined, but also the types of functions that can be applied to it. Through this, the data structure becomes an object that consists of both data and functions. Languages that use OOP concepts are Java, Python, C++, and Ruby.
definition_uz: Ob'ektga yo'naltirilgan dasturlash (OOP) dasturchilar tomonidan "harakat"" va ""mantiq"" emas

definition_eng: In Object-Oriented programming, a class refers to a set of related objects with common properties. Classes and the ability to create new classes render OOP a powerful and flexible programming model. For example, there might be a class called shapes which contains objects which are triangles, pentagons, square and circle.
definition_uz: Ob'ektga yo'naltirilgan dasturlashda sinf umumiy xususiyatlarga ega bo'lgan o'zaro bog'liq ob'ektlar to'plamiga ishora qiladi. Sinflar va yangi sinflarni yaratish qobiliyati OOP ni kuchli va moslashuvchan dasturlash modeliga aylantiradi. Masalan, uchburchaklar, beshburchaklar, kvadratlar va doiralar kabi ob'ektlarni o'z ichiga olgan shakllar sinfi bo'lishi mumkin.

definition_eng: Code or source code is a term used to describe a written set of instructions, written using the protocols of a particular language, such as Java, C or Python. The code can also be used informally to describe text written in a specific language. There are instances where references to the code are made for different languages, such as ‘PHP Code’, ‘HTML Code’,  ‘Java Code’ or ‘CSS Code’.
definition_uz: Kod yoki manba kodi - Java, C yoki Python kabi ma'lum bir tilning protokollari yordamida yozilgan yozma ko'rsatmalar to'plamini tavsiflash uchun ishlatiladigan atama. Kod ma'lum bir tilda yozilgan matnni tasvirlash uchun norasmiy ravishda ham qo'llanilishi mumkin. Kodga havolalar "PHP Code""

definition_eng: The command-line interface is a user interface based on the text. The UI is used to view and manage computer files. Command-line interfaces are also called command-line user interfaces, console user interfaces and character user interfaces. During the early 1960s and through the 1970s and 1980s, the command line interface was the primary means of interaction with most computers on terminals.
definition_uz: Buyruqlar qatori interfeysi matnga asoslangan foydalanuvchi interfeysidir. UI kompyuter fayllarini ko'rish va boshqarish uchun ishlatiladi. Buyruqlar qatori interfeyslari buyruq qatori foydalanuvchi interfeyslari, konsol foydalanuvchi interfeyslari va belgilar foydalanuvchi interfeyslari deb ham ataladi. 1960-yillarning boshlarida va 1970-1980-yillar davomida buyruq qatori interfeysi terminallardagi aksariyat kompyuterlar bilan o?zaro aloqa qilishning asosiy vositasi bo?lgan.

definition_eng: The process of creating an executable program through code written in a compiled programming language is called compilation. Through compiling, the computer can understand and run the program without using the programming software used to create it. A compiler is a program that translates computer programs written using letters, numbers, and characters into a machine language program. An example of a compiler in C++.
definition_uz: Kompilyatsiya qilingan dasturlash tilida yozilgan kod orqali bajariladigan dasturni yaratish jarayoni kompilyatsiya deb ataladi. Kompilyatsiya qilish orqali kompyuter dasturni yaratishda foydalanilgan dasturlash dasturidan foydalanmasdan uni tushunishi va ishga tushirishi mumkin. Kompilyator - harflar, raqamlar va belgilar yordamida yozilgan kompyuter dasturlarini mashina tilidagi dasturga o'tkazuvchi dastur. C++ da kompilyatorga misol.

definition_eng: Conditionals, conditional statements, and conditional expressions are features of programming language, which help the code make a choice and result in either TRUE or FALSE. These perform different actions depending on the need of the programmer, and multiple conditions can be combined into a single condition, as long as the final value of the condition is either TRUE or FALSE.  Examples of conditional statements are ‘IF’, ‘IF-Else’, ‘While’ and ‘Else-If’.
definition_uz: Shartlar, shartli bayonotlar va shartli ifodalar dasturlash tilining xususiyatlari bo'lib, kodga tanlov qilishga yordam beradi va natijada TRUE yoki FALSE bo'ladi. Bular dasturchining ehtiyojiga qarab turli amallarni bajaradi va shartning yakuniy qiymati TRUE yoki FALSE bo'lsa, bir nechta shartlar bitta shartga birlashtirilishi mumkin. Shartli gaplarga misol qilib, 'IF', 'IF-Else', 'While' va 'Else-If 'bo'lishi mumkin.

definition_eng: A constant (also known as Const) is a term used to describe a value that does not change throughout the execution of the program, unlike a variable. Constant cannot be altered and will remain fixed, and a constant can be a number, character, and string.
definition_uz: Konstanta (shuningdek, Const deb ham ataladi) o'zgaruvchidan farqli o'laroq, dasturning butun bajarilishi davomida o'zgarmaydigan qiymatni tavsiflash uchun ishlatiladigan atamadir. Konstantani o'zgartirib bo'lmaydi va o'zgarmas bo'lib qoladi va doimiy son, belgi va satr bo'lishi mumkin.

definition_eng: A data type is the classification of a particular type of data. We as humans can understand the difference between a name and a number, but the computer cannot. The computer uses special internal codes to distinguish between different types of data it receives and processes. The most common data types include integer type which are numbers, a floating-point number data type which are decimal based numbers, Boolean values which are TRUE or FALSE and character data type which is alphabets.
definition_uz: Ma'lumotlar turi - bu ma'lum turdagi ma'lumotlarning tasnifi. Biz odamlar ism va raqam o'rtasidagi farqni tushuna olamiz, lekin kompyuter tushuna olmaydi. Kompyuter qabul qiluvchi va qayta ishlanadigan har xil turdagi ma'lumotlarni farqlash uchun maxsus ichki kodlardan foydalanadi. Eng keng tarqalgan ma'lumotlar turlari qatoriga butun son turi, ya'ni sonlar, o'nlik sanoqli sonlar bo'lgan kasrlar ma'lumotlar turi, TRUE yoki FALSE bo'lgan mantiqiy qiymatlar va alfavitda  bo'lgan belgilar ma'lumotlar turiga kiradi.

definition_eng: Arrays are lists or groups of similar types of data values that are grouped. All values in the array are of the same data type and are only differentiated by their position in the array. For example, the age of all students in a class can be an array as they will all be numbers. Similarly, the name of every student in a class will be an array as they will all be of the character data type.
definition_uz: Massivlar - bu guruhlangan o'xshash turdagi ma'lumotlar qiymatlari ro'yxati yoki guruhlari. Massivdagi barcha qiymatlar bir xil turdagi ma’lumotlarga ega va faqat massivdagi joylashuvi bilan farqlanadi. Misol uchun, sinfdagi barcha o'quvchilarning yoshi massiv bo'lishi mumkin, chunki ularning barchasi raqamlar bo'ladi. Xuddi shunday, sinfdagi har bir talabaning nomi massiv bo'ladi, chunki ularning barchasi belgilar ma'lumotlari turiga ega bo'ladi.

definition_eng: A statement that describes a variable, function or any other identifier is called a declaration. A declaration helps the compiler or interpreter identify the word and understand its meaning, and how the process should be continued. Even though they are important, they are optional and may be used depending on the nature of the programming language
definition_uz: O'zgaruvchi, funktsiya yoki boshqa identifikatorni tavsiflovchi bayonot deklaratsiya deb ataladi. Deklaratsiya kompilyator yoki tarjimonga so'zni aniqlashga va uning ma'nosini tushunishga yordam beradi va jarayon qanday davom etishi kerakligini ham. Ular muhim bo'lishiga qaramay, ular ixtiyoriy va dasturlash tilining tabiatiga qarab ishlatilishi mumkin.

definition_eng: A special, unexpected and anomalous condition encountered during the execution of a program is known as an exception. It can also be termed as an error or a condition that alters the way of the program or the microprocessor to a different path. An example of an exception can be the case when a program tries to load a file from the disk, but the file does not exist. The exceptions must be handled and eradicated in the program code to avoid any fatal error.
definition_uz: Dasturni bajarish jarayonida yuzaga keladigan maxsus, kutilmagan va anomal holat istisno deb ataladi. Buni dastur yoki mikroprotsessorni boshqa yo'lga o'zgartiradigan xato yoki holat deb ham atash mumkin. Istisnoga misol qilib, dastur diskdan faylni yuklamoqchi bo'lgan, lekin fayl mavjud bo'lmagan holatlarni ko'rsatish mumkin. Har qanday halokatli xatolikka yo'l qo'ymaslik uchun istisnolar dastur kodida ko'rib chiqilishi va yo'q qilinishi kerak.

definition_eng: An expression is a legal grouping of letters, symbols, and numbers being used to represent the value of one or more variables. Expressions are highly used in a number of programming languages and many other programs, with each having its own set of legal and illegal expressions. Every expression contains one or more operands (objects being manipulated) and operators (symbols representing actions). For example, in the expression A+B-C, A, B and C are operands while + and – are operators.
definition_uz: Ifoda bir yoki bir nechta o'zgaruvchining qiymatini ifodalash uchun foydalaniladigan harflar, belgilar va raqamlarning qonuniy guruhlanishidir. Ifodalar bir qator dasturlash tillarida va boshqa ko'plab dasturlarda ko'p  qo'llaniladi, ularning har biri o'ziga xos qonuniy va noqonuniy iboralarga ega. Har bir ifoda bir yoki bir nechta operandlarni (manipulyatsiya qilinayotgan ob'ektlar) va operatorlarni (harakatlarni ifodalovchi belgilar) o'z ichiga oladi. Masalan, A+B-C ifodasida A, B va C operandlar, + va – operatorlardir.

definition_eng: Framework in programming is a foundation with a specified level of complexity that may be altered by the programmer, making use of their code. A framework might include different software libraries, APIs, compilers and much more. In simpler terms, a framework provides a favorable environment for a certain type and level of programming for a project. A framework allows the developers to bypass the general necessities and focus on more project-related specifics.
definition_uz: Dasturlashda ramkalar - bu dasturchi o'z kodlaridan foydalangan holda o'zgartirishi mumkin bo'lgan murakkablik darajasiga ega poydevor. Ramka turli xil dasturiy ta'minot kutubxonalarini, API'larni, kompilyatorlarni va boshqalarni o'z ichiga olishi mumkin. Oddiyroq qilib aytganda, ramka loyiha uchun dasturlashning ma'lum bir turi va darajasi uchun qulay muhitni ta'minlaydi. Ramka ishlab chiquvchilarga umumiy ehtiyojlarni chetlab o'tish va loyiha bilan bog'liq ko'proq xususiyatlarga e'tibor qaratish imkonini beradi.

definition_eng: In computer programming, the term hard code or hardcode is used to describe code that is not likely to change. Hardcoded features are built into hardware or software in such a way so that they cannot be modified later on. For example, if font size 10 is hardcoded in the software, then it might not change for a long time.
definition_uz: Kompyuter dasturlashda  qattiq kod atamasi o'zgarishi mumkin bo'lmagan kodni tavsiflash uchun ishlatiladi. Qattiq kodlangan xususiyatlar apparat yoki dasturiy ta'minotga shunday o'rnatilganki, ularni keyinchalik o'zgartirib bo'lmaydi. Misol uchun, agar shrift o'lchami 10 dasturiy ta'minotda qattiq kodlangan bo'lsa, u uzoq vaqt davomida o'zgarmasligi mumkin.

definition_eng: A loop is a sequence of instructions that repeat the same process over and over until a condition is met and it receives the order to stop. In a loop, the program asks a question, and if the answer directs the program to perform an action, the action is performed, and the loop runs again, performing the same task. It runs until the answer is such that no action is required and the code can proceed further. Loops are considered one of the most basic and powerful concepts in programming.
definition_uz: Loop - bu shart bajarilmaguncha va u to'xtatish buyrug'ini olguncha bir xil jarayonni qayta-qayta takrorlaydigan ko'rsatmalar ketma-ketligi. Davrada dastur savol beradi va agar javob dasturni biror harakatni bajarishga yo‘naltirsa, harakat bajariladi va sikl yana o‘sha vazifani bajarib ishlaydi. Bu javob hech qanday harakat talab etilmaguncha ishlaydi va kod davom etishi mumkin. Looplar dasturlashda eng asosiy va kuchli tushunchalardan biri hisoblanadi.

definition_eng: An endless loop or infinite loop is a continuous repetition of a program snippet, which is everlasting. This occurs majorly due to conditional operators and functions which redirect the code back to the snippet, making it endless.An endless loop or infinite loop is a continuous repetition of a program snippet, which is everlasting. This occurs majorly due to conditional operators and functions which redirect the code back to the snippet, making it endless.
definition_uz: Cheksiz tsikl- bu abadiy bo'lgan dastur parchasining doimiy takrorlanishi. Bu, asosan, shartli operatorlar va kodni parchaga qayta yo'naltiruvchi funktsiyalar tufayli yuzaga keladi va uni cheksiz qiladi.

definition_eng: Iteration is a single pass through a set of operations that deal with code. One form of iteration in computer programming is via loops. A loop will repeat a certain segment of code until a condition is met and it can proceed further. Each time the computer runs a loop, it is known as an iteration. In simple terms, iteration is the process to repeat a particular snippet of code over and over again to perform a certain action.
definition_uz: Iteratsiya - bu kod bilan shug'ullanadigan operatsiyalar to'plamidan bir marta o'tish. Kompyuter dasturlashda iteratsiya shakllaridan biri tsikllar orqali amalga oshiriladi. Loop kodning ma'lum bir segmentini shart bajarilmaguncha takrorlaydi va u davom etishi mumkin. Kompyuter har safar tsiklni ishga tushirganda, u iteratsiya deb nomlanadi. Oddiy qilib aytganda, iteratsiya - bu ma'lum bir harakatni bajarish uchun kodning ma'lum bir qismini qayta-qayta takrorlash jarayoni.

definition_eng: Words that are reserved by a programming language or a program as they have special meaning are known as keywords. These keywords are reserved to perform certain tasks, and they can be either commands or parameters. Each programming language has a set of reserved keywords (also known as reserved names) which cannot be used as variable names. Some keywords in ‘C’ language are ‘return’, ‘while’, ‘if’, ‘static’, ‘continue’ and ‘default’.
definition_uz: Maxsus ma'noga ega bo'lgan dasturlash tili yoki dastur tomonidan zahiralangan so'zlar kalit so'zlar deb nomlanadi. Ushbu kalit so'zlar muayyan vazifalarni bajarish uchun ajratilgan va ular buyruqlar yoki parametrlar bo'lishi mumkin. Har bir dasturlash tilida o'zgaruvchilar nomlari sifatida foydalanish mumkin bo'lmagan zaxiralangan kalit so'zlar to'plami mavjud (shuningdek, zahiralangan nomlar). "C"" tilidagi ba'zi kalit so'zlar ""qaytish""

definition_eng: An operand is a term used to denote the objects which can be manipulated using different operators. In the expression ‘A+F+Q’, ‘A’, ‘F’ and ‘Q’ are operands.
definition_uz: Operand - bu turli operatorlar yordamida boshqarilishi mumkin bo'lgan ob'ektlarni belgilash uchun ishlatiladigan atama. “A+F+Q” iborasida “A”, “F” va “Q” operandlardir.

definition_eng: An operator is a term used to denote the object which can manipulate different operands. In the expression ‘A+F-Q’, ‘+’ and ‘-‘are operators. Examples of different operators are + (addition), -- (decrement), = (equals), != (not equal) and >= (greater than or equal to).
definition_uz: Operator - bu turli operandlarni boshqarishi mumkin bo'lgan ob'ektni belgilash uchun ishlatiladigan atama. ‘A+F-Q’ ifodasida ‘+’ va ‘-‘ operatorlardir. Turli operatorlarga + (qo‘shish), -- (kamaytirish), = (teng), != (teng emas) va >= (katta yoki teng) misol bo‘la oladi.

definition_eng: A variable is a location that stores temporary data within a program which can be modified, store and display whenever need. For example, if we have an integer variable with a name XYZ and it stores a value 10. If the variable is again initiated with a different value, it will store the new value. So if XYZ=9 is implemented, the variable location of XYZ will discard the value 10 and store the new value, which is 9.
definition_uz: O'zgaruvchi - bu dastur ichidagi vaqtinchalik ma'lumotlarni saqlaydigan joy, uni o'zgartirish, saqlash va kerak bo'lganda ko'rsatish mumkin. Misol uchun, agar bizda XYZ nomli butun o'zgaruvchi bo'lsa va u 10 qiymatini saqlasa. Agar o'zgaruvchi yana boshqa qiymat bilan ishga tushirilsa, u yangi qiymatni saqlaydi. Shunday qilib, agar XYZ = 9 amalga oshirilsa, XYZ ning o'zgarmaydigan joylashuvi 10 qiymatini o'chiradi va yangi qiymatni saqlaydi, ya'ni 9.

definition_eng: In programming, a pointer is a variable that contains the address of a location in the memory. The location is the commencing point of an object, such as an element of the array or an integer. Using pointers improves the performance of the program as it is cheaper in time and space to copy and dereference pointers than to copy and access the data to which the pointer is referring.
definition_uz: Dasturlashda ko'rsatgich xotiradagi joylashuv manzilini o'z ichiga olgan o'zgaruvchidir. Joylashuv ob'ektning boshlanish nuqtasidir, masalan, massiv elementi yoki butun son. Ko'rsatkichlardan foydalanish dasturning ishlashini yaxshilaydi, chunki ko'rsatgich ko'rsatuvchi ma'lumotlardan nusxa ko'chirish va ularga kirishdan ko'ra ko'rsatkichlarni nusxalash va yo'qotish vaqt va makon jihatidan arzonroqdir.

definition_eng: A high-level language (HLL) is a programming language that lets the developer write programs irrespective of the nature or type of computer. But if a computer has to understand a high-level language, it should be compiled into a machine language. HLLs are considered high-level because they are in close proximity to human languages and further from machine languages. High-level languages include BASIC, C, C++, Pascal, Prolog, and FORTRAN.
definition_uz: Yuqori darajali til (HLL) dasturlash tili bo'lib, dasturchiga kompyuterning tabiati yoki turidan qat'iy nazar dasturlar yozish imkonini beradi. Ammo agar kompyuter yuqori darajadagi tilni tushunishi kerak bo'lsa, uni mashina tiliga kompilyatsiya qilish kerak. HLLlar yuqori darajali hisoblanadi, chunki ular inson tillariga yaqin va mashina tillaridan uzoqda joylashgan. Yuqori darajadagi tillarga BASIC, C, C++, Paskal, Prolog va FORTRAN kiradi.

definition_eng: A low-level language is a language that is very close to machine language and provides a little abstraction of programming concepts. Low-level languages are closer to the hardware than human languages. The most common examples of low-level languages are assembly and machine code.
definition_uz: Past darajadagi til - bu mashina tiliga juda yaqin bo'lgan va dasturlash tushunchalarining biroz mavhumligini ta'minlaydigan til. Past darajadagi tillar inson tillariga qaraganda apparatga yaqinroqdir. Past darajadagi tillarning eng keng tarqalgan misollari montaj va mashina kodidir.

definition_eng: Also known as machine code, machine language is a lowest-level programming language consisting of binary digits or bits that are read by computers. Machine language is the only language understood by computers. As it consists of only numbers, they cannot be comprehended by humans. Therefore, programmers write code in the high-level language, which is then translated into assembly language or machine language by a compiler, which is then converted to a machine language by an assembler.
definition_uz: Mashina kodi sifatida ham tanilgan, mashina tili kompyuterlar tomonidan o'qiladigan ikkilik raqamlar yoki bitlardan tashkil topgan eng past darajadagi dasturlash tilidir. Mashina tili kompyuterlar tushunadigan yagona tildir. U faqat raqamlardan iborat bo'lgani uchun ularni inson tushunib bo'lmaydi. Shuning uchun dasturchilar kodni yuqori darajadagi tilda yozadilar, so'ngra kompilyator tomonidan assembler tiliga yoki mashina tiliga tarjima qilinadi, so'ngra assembler tomonidan mashina tiliga o'zgartiriladi.

definition_eng: A markup language is a relatively simple language that consists of easily understood keywords and tags, used to format the overall view of the page and its contents. The language specifies codes for formatting the layout and style of a page, within a text file only. The most common markup languages are Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), Extensible Markup Language (XML) and Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML).
definition_uz: Belgilash tili nisbatan sodda til bo'lib, u oson tushuniladigan kalit so'zlar va teglardan iborat bo'lib, sahifaning umumiy ko'rinishini va uning mazmunini formatlash uchun ishlatiladi. Til faqat matn faylida sahifaning tartibi va uslubini formatlash uchun kodlarni belgilaydi. Eng keng tarqalgan belgilash tillari: Gipermatn belgilash tili (HTML), Kengaytiriladigan belgilash tili (XML) va standart umumlashtirilgan belgilash tili (SGML).

definition_eng: A package is an organized module of related interfaces and classes. Packages are used to organize classes that belong to the same category or provide related functionality.
definition_uz: Paket - bu tegishli interfeyslar va sinflarning tashkil etilgan modulidir. Paketlar bir xil toifaga kiruvchi yoki tegishli funksionallikni ta'minlovchi sinflarni tashkil qilish uchun ishlatiladi.

definition_eng: Runtime or runtime is the time period during which a program is, in fact, running on a computer. If an operation occurs at ‘runtime’, it occurred when a program is running or the moment at which the program begins to run. Also known as execution time, the runtime is part of the life cycle of the program, and it denotes the time between when the program begins running and until it is closed by the OS or the user.
definition_uz: Ish vaqti  - bu dastur aslida kompyuterda ishlayotgan vaqt davri. Agar operatsiya "ishlash vaqtida"" sodir bo'lsa

definition_eng: Backend is another term used for background in programming. A backend task is the one that is performed in the background with the user’s direct interaction. Similarly, a backend developer is a person who designs programs that process data and perform tasks that users don’t directly see.
definition_uz: Backend - bu dasturlashda fon uchun ishlatiladigan yana bir atama. Backend vazifasi - bu foydalanuvchining bevosita ishtiroki bilan fonda bajariladigan vazifa. Xuddi shunday, backend dasturchisi ma'lumotlarni qayta ishlaydigan va foydalanuvchilar to'g'ridan-to'g'ri ko'rmaydigan vazifalarni bajaradigan dasturlarni ishlab chiqadigan shaxsdir.

definition_eng: The Front-end is the user interface of a computer or any device. For example, any operating system provides users with the ease of navigation. A program or OS is considered good if the UI or Front-end is easy to use and seamless to navigate. Front-end developers are the programmers who design and develop the user interface of a device.
definition_uz: Front-end - bu kompyuter yoki har qanday qurilmaning foydalanuvchi interfeysi. Misol uchun, har qanday operatsion tizim foydalanuvchilarga navigatsiya qulayligini ta'minlaydi. Agar UI yoki Front-end ishlatish uchun qulay va navigatsiya qilish muammosiz bo'lsa, dastur yoki OT(Operatsion tizim) yaxshi hisoblanadi. Front-end dasturchilar - bu qurilmaning foydalanuvchi interfeysini loyihalash va ishlab chiqish bilan shug'ullanadigan dasturchilar.

definition_eng: When procedures and processes are performed on the server, they are deemed server-side. On the other hand, the client-side is at the end of the user. Many programming languages are designed for server-side programmings such as PHP, Perl, and ASP. With the internet boom, almost all websites make use of both server-side and client-side processing. An excellent example of a server-side script is a search engine.
definition_uz: Serverda protseduralar va jarayonlar bajarilganda, ular server tomoni hisoblanadi. Boshqa tomondan, mijoz tomoni foydalanuvchining oxirida joylashgan. Ko'pgina dasturlash tillari PHP, Perl va ASP kabi server tomoni dasturlari uchun mo'ljallangan. Internet portlashi bilan deyarli barcha veb-saytlar server tomonida ham, mijoz tomonidan ham ishlov berishdan foydalanadi. Server tomonidagi skriptning ajoyib namunasi qidiruv tizimidir.

definition_eng: Source data or data source is the key location from which data is used in the program. The source data can come from a database, spreadsheet or even a hard-coded data location. When a program is executed to display data in a table, the program retrieves the data from its source and then presents it in the arrangement as defined in the code.
definition_uz: Manba ma'lumotlari yoki ma'lumotlar manbai dasturda ma'lumotlardan foydalaniladigan asosiy joydir. Manba ma'lumotlari ma'lumotlar bazasidan, elektron jadvaldan yoki hatto qattiq kodlangan ma'lumotlar joylashuvidan olinishi mumkin. Jadvalda ma'lumotlarni ko'rsatish uchun dastur bajarilganda, dastur o'z manbasidan ma'lumotlarni oladi va keyin ularni kodda belgilangan tartibda taqdim etadi.

definition_eng: In programming, a statement is a single line of code written legally in a programming language that expresses an action to be carried out. A statement might have internal components of its own, including expressions, operators and functions. An example of a statement is A = A + 5. A program is nothing but a sequence of one or multiple statements.
definition_uz: Dasturlashda bayonot - bu dasturlash tilida qonuniy ravishda yozilgan, bajarilishi kerak bo'lgan harakatni ifodalovchi yagona kod qatori. Bayonot o'ziga xos ichki komponentlarga, jumladan ifodalar, operatorlar va funktsiyalarga ega bo'lishi mumkin. A = A + 5 bayonotiga misol. Dastur bir yoki bir nechta bayonotlar ketma-ketligidan boshqa narsa emas.

definition_eng: Similar to human languages, programming languages have their own set of rules on how statements can be conveyed. The set of these rules is known as syntax. While a number of programming languages share many features, functions, and capabilities, they differ in syntax. Without the proper use of the syntax, one cannot write an executable program, and a wrong syntax will lead to a plethora of errors.
definition_uz: Inson tillariga o'xshab, dasturlash tillari bayonotlarni qanday etkazish mumkinligi bo'yicha o'z qoidalariga ega. Ushbu qoidalar to'plami sintaksis deb nomlanadi. Bir qator dasturlash tillari ko'plab xususiyatlar, funktsiyalar va imkoniyatlarga ega bo'lsa-da, ular sintaksis jihatidan farq qiladi. Sintaksisdan to'g'ri foydalanmasdan turib, bajariladigan dasturni yozib bo'lmaydi, noto'g'ri sintaksis esa ko'plab xatolarga olib keladi.

definition_eng: A token is the smallest individual unit in a program, often referring to a portion of a much larger data piece. For example, if a person’s name is John Thomas Wood, it can be broken into tokens; ‘John’, ‘Thomas’ and ‘Wood’. The programmer can then go on to use only the portion or token they wish to. Tokens are classified into keywords, identifiers, literals, operators, and punctuators.
definition_uz: Token dasturdagi eng kichik individual birlik bo?lib, ko?pincha ancha kattaroq ma?lumotlar qismining bir qismiga ishora qiladi. Misol uchun, agar shaxsning ismi Jon Tomas Vud bo'lsa, u tokenlarga bo'linishi mumkin; "Jon""

definition_eng: A statistical way of comparing two (or more) techniques, typically an incumbent against a new rival. A/B testing aims to determine not only which technique performs better but also to understand whether the difference is statistically significant. A/B testing usually considers only two techniques using one measurement, but it can be applied to any finite number of techniques and measures.
definition_uz: Ikki (yoki undan ortiq) texnikani solishtirishning statistik usuli, odatda yangi raqibga qarshi. A/B testi nafaqat qaysi texnika yaxshiroq ishlashini aniqlashga, balki farqning statistik jihatdan ahamiyatli yoki yo'qligini tushunishga qaratilgan. A/B testi odatda bitta o'lchovdan foydalangan holda faqat ikkita texnikani ko'rib chiqadi, lekin u har qanday cheklangan miqdordagi texnika va o'lchovlarga qo'llanilishi mumkin.

definition_eng: A non-human program or model that can solve sophisticated tasks. For example, a program or model that translates text or a program or model that identifies diseases from radiologic images both exhibit artificial intelligence.Formally, machine learning is a sub-field of artificial intelligence. However, in recent years, some organizations have begun using the terms artificial intelligence and machine learning interchangeably.
definition_uz: Murakkab vazifalarni hal qila oladigan insoniy bo'lmagan dastur yoki model. Masalan, matnni tarjima qiladigan dastur yoki model yoki radiologik tasvirlardan kasalliklarni aniqlaydigan dastur yoki model ikkalasi ham murakkab vazifalarni hal qila oladigan insoniy bo'lmagan dastur yoki model. Masalan, matnni tarjima qiladigan dastur yoki model yoki radiologik tasvirlardan kasalliklarni aniqlaydigan dastur yoki model ikkalasi ham sun'iy intellektni namoyish etadi.Rasmiy ravishda, mashinani o'rganish sun'iy intellektning kichik sohasidir. Biroq, so'nggi yillarda ba'zi tashkilotlar sun'iy intellekt va mashinani o'rganish atamalarini bir-birining o'rniga ishlatishni boshladilar.

definition_eng: Synonym for feature. In fairness, attributes often refer to characteristics pertaining to individuals.
definition_uz: Xususiyatning sinonimi. Asosan,atributlar ko'pincha shaxslarga tegishli xususiyatlarga ishora qiladi.

definition_eng: Natural language processing (NLP) concerns itself with the interaction between natural human languages and computing devices. NLP is a major aspect of computational linguistics, and also falls within the realms of computer science and artificial intelligence.
definition_uz: Tabiiy tilni qayta ishlash (NLP) tabiiy inson tillari va hisoblash qurilmalari o'rtasidagi o'zaro ta'sirni ifodalaydi.NLP hisoblash tilshunosligining asosiy yo'nalishi bo'lib, shuningdek, kompyuter fanlari va sun'iy intellekt sohalariga kiradi.

definition_eng: Tokenization is, generally, an early step in the NLP process, a step which splits longer strings of text into smaller pieces, or tokens. Larger chunks of text can be tokenized into sentences, sentences can be tokenized into words, etc. Further processing is generally performed after a piece of text has been appropriately tokenized.
definition_uz: Tokenizatsiya, odatda, NLP jarayonidagi dastlabki qadam bo'lib, uzunroq matn qatorlarini kichikroq bo'laklarga yoki tokenlarga bo'ladigan qadamdir.Matnning katta qismlarini jumlalarga, jumlalarni so'zlarga ajratish mumkin va hokazo.Keyinchalik qayta ishlash odatda matnning bir qismi tegishli tokenizatsiya qilinganidan keyin amalga oshiriladi.

definition_eng: Before further processing, text needs to be normalized. Normalization generally refers to a series of related tasks meant to put all text on a level playing field: converting all text to the same case (upper or lower), removing punctuation, expanding contractions, converting numbers to their word equivalents, and so on. Normalization puts all words on equal footing, and allows processing to proceed uniformly.
definition_uz: Keyingi ishlov berishdan oldin matnni normallashtirish kerak. Normalizatsiya odatda barcha matnni bir xil o'yin maydoniga qo'yishga qaratilgan bir qator bog'liq vazifalarni anglatadi: barcha matnni bir xil registrga (yuqori yoki pastki) aylantirish, tinish belgilarini olib tashlash, qisqarishlarni kengaytirish, raqamlarni so'z ekvivalentlariga aylantirish va hokazo.
